The former West Midlands goalkeeper was dropped from the USMNT training camp ahead of the Gold Cup. Steffen (knee) and a former goalkeeper were set to miss the Concacaf Gold Cup as the United States manager.

trending.title: Delap joins Chelsea from Ipswich in $40.6m deal
trending.description: Chelsea have signed striker Liam Delap from Ipswich Town in a four-year deal. The 24-year-old joined the club in November as a free agent. Delap has been linked with the signing of former Chelsea back-rower David Cameron and former Chelsea midfielder Paul McCoy. He has also played for Ipswich City since the departure of Ryan McCoy. Delap, who played for Ipswich in 2001, will join Chelsea from Ipswich Town in the summer. Delap has been linked with the signing of former Chelsea back-rower David Cameron.
